pnp:Provisioning.Author: John White
pnp:Provisioning.Description: Example site to manage brand assets

pnp:ListInstance.Title: Class Materials
pnp:ListInstance.Description: This is a place where teacher can store class materials and students won't be able to edit them

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Welcome to Physical Science with Ms. Berger!

The world around you is made up of atoms. Everything that you see, eat, touch, buy is atoms that combine to make molecules which combine to make compounds which end up as things! In this class you will learn about how daily phenomena relates to concepts of physics and chemistry. ​​​​​​​

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Physical Science learning videos

These major topics we cover in class can be reviewed anytime through the Stream playlist below. Use this as you prepare for quizzes and tests, its a great resource for you to feel confident in your knowledge.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
About Ms. Berger​​​
Hi class! This is my second year teaching at Pineview. I am originally from Seattle, WA (go hawks!) and, yes, I do love the rain. When I am not teaching and grading your work, I love to read, hike and play with my dogs. 
​​​​​​​


​​​​​​​Contact Ms. Berger anytime by email: tberger@pineveiw.edu

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Tune into interview with International Space Station astronaut

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Hey class, I wanted to remind you that today NASA will be streaming a 1 hour Ask-Me-Anything interview with Joe Acaba, an astronaut onboard the the International Space Station. I think you will all enjoy this interview very much, so remember to tune in at 5pm PST. 





Here's a snippet from a similar interview hosted by NASA last year.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Midterms in 2 weeks & how to prepare early

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Midterms are coming up in a few weeks. It's always best to prepare early. Here are some tips from me.

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: A new resource to help you write reports

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Have a report to write and not sure where to start? Report templates give you a starting point and can help you organize your information. 

Here is a collection of report templates you can download and start using now:

Simple report

This accessible pre-formatted template includes styles for headings, quotes, numbered and bulleted lists.

Report with cover image

Simple and accessible template that can be used for book reports, history reports, or other school essays.

APA-style report

With specific instructions and formatting based on the APA 6th edition guidelines, this APA template will help save time and prevent mistakes. The template includes details on creating APA compliant charts, layouts, footnotes, and more. This is an accessible template.

MLA-style paper

Does your research or term paper require MLA format? Use this accessible template to help you follow the proper guidelines. Includes styles formatted to match MLA guidelines and instructional text.

For some, remote learning can be a welcome change from classroom learning because of the flexibility it provides, and it can better match learning styles for some. For others, remote learning can be less appealing due to the lack of in-person social contact. No matter where you stand, remote learning can be challenging for everyone in different ways. Here are some tips to keep you engaged, productive, and feeling good about your learning experience.

Set daily or weekly goals to help you stay focused; then schedule time to do specific work toward your goals. Structuring your time in a consistent way will help you meet your goals.

​​​​​​​

Reduce distractions: Find a place where you can work without distractions. If you live with your family or other people, and don’t already have a space, you may need to negotiate a space where you can work consistently. Alternatively, the use of headphones can help minimize distractions. You may also want to turn off notifications on your devices when you’re working and try to avoid multitasking.


Fully participate in virtual classroom time. It might be tempting to multitask during an online class, but once your attention is taken away from the lecture or conversation in the class, it may be hard to catch up again with what’s happening in the class.

Schedule time to connect with people in virtual face-to-face meetings. This can include your fellow students and can include scheduling 1-1 time with your professors. You can also plan virtual study groups or project groups.

​​​​​​​

Take breaks: Sitting and looking at a device screen for too long can actually reduce your productivity. Take time to get up and stretch, go for a walk, or engage in some other physical activity. You can come back to your work with fresh eyes. In addition, make time for breaks where you and your fellow students and friends can chat socially or play online games together.​​​​​​​
